document_data.caption: ''A vile vial of dragon's bile.''
document_data.name: Dragon Bile
document_data.mainbody: '''[[Dragon bile]]''' was just that, bile extracted from a [[dragon]]'s gallbladder and turned into a potent contact [[poison]].{{Cite dragon/391/Assassin, Executioner|36}}
document_data.Description: Apart from bones and scales, dragon's bile was perhaps the most sought-after part of a slain wyrm. A competent poison maker could turn the draconic substance into a poison of varied strengths. The strongest type of dragon bile was collected from ancient dragons and wielded only by the most deadly of assassins.
document_data.Powers:
Dragon bile was most often used to coat [[blade]]s. When the poison was introduced onto a target's skin or in their bloodstream, the substance started sapping their strength. Despite dragon bile rarely causing death, its weakening effect was devastatingly dangerous. A single vial of the substance usually held enough poison for five applications.

Dragon bile was commonly used as poison in [[trap]]s or as coating for [[lock]]s or other object prone to be touched by [[thieves]] and rogues.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1374}}, dragon bile was sold by [[mind flayer]]s of the illithid black market hidden in the mountains west of [[Samargol]] in the jungles of [[Samarach]].
